posts.author: Demos
posts.content:
Just some quick observations and suggestions:

I don't Dodge and Mobility are helping you out here. I know you'll be running around, but your Tumble score is high enough to avoid Attacks of Opportunity. With CON of 8 (ouch!), I would take Toughness and Extend Spell instead. Also, I don't think you need to bump INT. I know it will help with your Death Attack DC, but you'll have Curse Song (-2 Fort Save with the Lev 16 song) and also Fox's Cunning to help boost INT. The loss of Skill Points shouldn't be too big a deal since I would drop Bluff altogether (unless there is an Arelith specific use for it). Swapping your INT increases for DEX lets you end up with DEX 28 so +2 to AB and AC. Also, Bard Song 16 only needs 30 ranks in Perform so ESF: Perform is wasted (unless there are other benefits to have such a high Perform). I would take Armor Skin instead. Also, Taunting won't be useful because you have to be right next to the opponent whereas you want to be far away. Drop that for some trapping skills to help with damage output since darts will need help.

posts.author: Demos
posts.content:
You may be better off with an 11 Bard / 19 Assassin split. Why? In a lev 30 environment, you'll be capped at 20 levels of Assassin. The Bard Song progression (in reverse) goes 16, 15, 14, 11, 8, 6, 3, 2, 1. Death Attack relies on a Fort Save and Curse Song applies a -2 penalty at song levels 15 and 16, and a -1 penalty at song levels 3 to 14. Since your complaint is the low DC, I would max out Assassin levels while taking the closest Bard Song progression allowed. You lose 1 on the Fort Save from Curse, but gain 5 to the Death Attack DC, so you come out ahead by 4 points.

Also, Bard 11 only has access to level 4 spells so your CHA needs to only be 14 and so you have a few more points to use on your starting spread.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
That made me very confused!! :O
So if you attack a Flat footed enemy, even if they are in combat they take save vs paralyse?
And if Curse song makes Death Attack redundant, then there is no point in Curse song... Unless what I said above is correct, then I need a way to make flat footed..?
I think I know what may be causing your confusion. When you attack someone for the first time, they're flat-footed and out of combat mode. The fact that they're out of combat will trigger the paralysis effect of Death Attack, not the fact that they're flat-footed. They'll roll the save and from then on, you'll have to disengage from combat (and make your opponent disengage as well) to be able to apply the paralysis effect again. Now if you keep fighting the guy and then KD him, for example, on top of your head, you'll read Death Attack because he is flat-footed, but he won't be rolling vs paralysis because he's already in combat, just the extra damage will be applied. Basically, not everytime you see Death Attack pop out of your head means that the other guy is making a save.

There are two ways to disengage that you can use with this toon:

1- Use Darkness: cast it behind you, go in it then hide again, come out after a few seconds and hit the guy "for the first time" again.

2- Cast invisibility on yourself or drink an Invisibility potion, wait 6 seconds after they've stopped chasing you and attack again. Invisibility potions / scrolls also work.

That's why HiPS is so valuable to Assassins, they can use it to "spam" Death Attacks and paralyze everyone.

Take it EZ!
